definition: to save/to economize/to do without/to omit/to leave out/province/(archaic) central government department
to inspect/to examine/to be aware/to pay a visit (to one's parents or elders)

sentences.english: In a word, the characters reflect each other's desires with an extremely introspective attitude.
sentences.chinese: 画中人以某种极端内省的姿态照映出彼此的欲望。

sentences.english: The Riau province of Indonesia is home to one of the densest tropical forests in the world.
sentences.chinese: 印尼廖内省是世界最密集的热带森林之一。

sentences.english: You have to clear your problems, face yourself and introspect .
sentences.chinese: 你必须要清理问题，要面对自己而且内省。

sentences.english: You cannot discover yourself by introspection.
sentences.chinese: 只通过内省发现不了真正的自己。

sentences.english: It's the time where we stop the class and you look inward.
sentences.chinese: 这段时间会我们停止课程，进行内省。

sentences.english: Behaviourism leaves out of account consciousness and introspection.
sentences.chinese: 行为主义不把意识和内省考虑在内。

sentences.english: Within Indonesia, the situation is most critical in Riau.
sentences.chinese: 在印度尼西亚国内，情况最严重的地区就是廖内省。

sentences.english: Inwardness is what an Englishman quite simply has, painlessly, as a birthright.
sentences.chinese: 内省是英国人与生俱来，不用费力培养就拥有的特质。

sentences.english: When we see men of a contrary character, we should turn inwards and examine ourselves.
sentences.chinese: 当我们见到人们乖张的个性，我们应内省反求诸己。

sentences.english: It rejects the introspection of psychology as well as all historical disciplines.
sentences.chinese: 它不仅拒绝所有历史训练方法，还拒绝心理学的内省。

sentences.english: First of all, we have to introspect.
They want a man who is maybe a little mysterious and alluring. A man who`s more introspective.
sentences.chinese: 她们喜欢有点儿神秘，充满诱惑力，更加内省的男人。

sentences.english: They can also introspect into a closure just like a normal function can.
sentences.chinese: 它们还可以像普通函数一样内省到闭包中。

sentences.english: Fifth, guide network main body's contrition.
sentences.chinese: 其五，引导网络主体不断“内省”和“慎独”。

sentences.english: At the new moon, May 24, you will begin a quieter, more introspective period.
sentences.chinese: 5月24日的新月后你将变得沉默而内省。

definition: to examine oneself/to reflect on one's shortcomings/introspection/self-awareness/self-criticism
to examine/to cast a critical eye over (especially in the context of introspection)
to lurk under water/to immerse oneself in (study etc)/to lie low/to keep a low profile/quiet/reserved/self-possessed
to seek the cause in oneself rather than sb else
to preserve a proper behavior in private life
inner transcendence (perfection through one's own inner moral cultivation, as in Confucianism, for example)
outstanding/to fast-track/to elevate/to free oneself from
to study the underlying principle to acquire knowledge (idiom); pursuing knowledge to the end
